Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the chess board itself and retains functionalities which involve controlling the board. Example.) moving the pieces

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board()
      This method is a constructor to create a new board object, an 8x8 array of pieces

      • getPiece

        public Piece getPiece​(int r,
                      int c)
        This method gets the Piece at a specified row and col
        Parameters:
        r - - the specified row for which piece you want
        c - - the specified column for which piece you want
        Returns:
        Piece - returns object of type piece at location board[r][c]

      • removePiece

        public void removePiece​(Piece p)
        This method removes a Piece from the board
        Parameters:
        p - - input of object with type Piece, in order for it to be removed from the board

      • insertPiece

        public void insertPiece​(int r,
                        int c,
                        Piece p)
        This method inserts a Piece into the board at specified row,col
        Parameters:
        r - - row position for a Piece to be inserted in
        c - - column position for a Piece to be inserted in
        p - - object of type Piece to be inserted at position board[r][c]

      • move

        public boolean move​(int endRow,
                    int endCol,
                    Board board,
                    Piece p)
        This method moves a Piece to a specified row,col on the board
        Parameters:
        endRow - - ending row position for a Piece to be moved to
        endCol - - ending column position for a Piece to be moved to
        board - - object of type Board that stores current state of chess board and spots to move
        p - - object of type Piece to be moved to a specified ending row / column
        Returns:
        boolean - returns true if the move was succesful, and false otherwise

      • canCastle

        public boolean canCastle​(int endRow,
                         int endCol,
                         Piece p,
                         Board board)
        This method takes in a piece and determines if its movement to a specific row/col is a valid castle
        Parameters:
        endRow - - ending row position for a Piece to be moved to
        endCol - - ending column position for a Piece to be moved to
        p - - object of type Piece to check to see if a castle is possible with that piece
        board - - object of type Board that stores current state of chess board and spots to move
        Returns:
        boolean - returns true if castling is possible based on specified piece, endRow, endCol, otherwise returns false

      • pawnPromotion

        public boolean pawnPromotion​(Piece p,
                             int endRow,
                             int endCol)
        This method takes in a piece and determines if its movement to a specific row/col is a valid pawn promotion
        Parameters:
        p - - object of type Piece to check to see if pawn promotion is possible with that piece
        endRow - - ending row position for a Piece to be moved to
        endCol - - ending column position for a Piece to be moved to
        Returns:
        boolean - returns true if pawn promotion is possible based on specified piece, endRow, endCol, otherwise returns false

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getPossibleMoves​(Piece p)

        Parameters:
        p - - takes an object of type Piece for which to determine all it's possible moved
        Returns:
        ArrayList - returns an arraylist of strings containing all the possible moves of a given Piece

      • findKing

        public java.lang.String findKing​(int player)
        This methods returns a string of the current location of the king of the specified player, either white or black
        Parameters:
        player - - takes an input of an integer player representing the color, white or black, to find the location of the given player's king
        Returns:
        String - returns a string of the row+col of the given player's king

      • isCheck

        public boolean isCheck​(int player)
        this method returns true if a specific player,white or black, is in check or false otherwise
        Parameters:
        player - - takes an input of an integer player representing the color, white or black, to determine if a given player is in Check
        Returns:
        boolean - returns true if the player is in check, otherwise false

      • isCheckMate

        public boolean isCheckMate​(int player)
        this method returns true if a specific player,white or black, is in checkmate or false otherwise
        Parameters:
        player - - takes an input of an integer player representing the color, white or black, to determine if a given player is in Check mate
        Returns:
        boolean - returns true if the player is in checkmate, otherwise false

      • getCheckingPiece

        public Piece getCheckingPiece​(int player)
        this method returns the piece that is currently threatening the given player, white or black.
        Parameters:
        player - - takes an input of an integer player representing the color, white or black, to get the piece that is threatening the player's king
        Returns:
        Piece - returns an object of type Piece that is currently threatening the king

      • playerCanMove

        public boolean playerCanMove​(int r,
                             int c,
                             int player)
        this method returns true if a given player, white or black, has any pieces that can move to a specified r,c. Otherwise, returns false
        Parameters:
        r - - row input to see if a player, white or black, has any pieces that can move to the given row, r
        c - - column input to see if a player, white or black, has any pieces that can move to the given col, c
        player - - integer of either 0 or 1, where 0 represents white and 1 represents black
        Returns:
        boolean - returns true if any pieces of the player can move to a specific location r,c

      • testMove

        public boolean testMove​(int r,
                        int c,
                        Piece p)
        This method returns true if a given piece can legally move to a specified location and returns false if moving results in check
        Parameters:
        r - - row for a specfic piece to be moved to
        c - - column for a specfic piece to be moved to
        p - - object of type Piece to test if p can be moved to the corresponding r,c without reulting in check
        Returns:
        boolean - returns true if Piece p can legally move to r,c. Returns false if moving results in a check
